node.title: WHO advises people over 60 or with underlying conditions to postpone travel to COVID hotspots
node.description: The World Health Organization advises people who are unwell or vulnerable to severe disease or death from COVID-19, including people aged over 60, to postpone travel to hotspot areas.
node.content:
["The World Health Organization (WHO) has advised people who are unwell or vulnerable to severe disease or death from COVID-19,\u00a0including people aged over 60, to postpone travel to hotspot areas.\u00a0", "In its latest guidance to authorities and travellers, the WHO said people over 60 years who are not fully vaccinated or do not have proof of previous SARS-COV-2 infection and those with underlying health conditions\u00a0should be advised to postpone travel to areas of community transmission, as they are at higher risk of disease and death.", "\"Persons who are unwell,\u00a0or who have not been fully vaccinated or do not have proof of previous SARS-CoV-2 infection and are at increased risk of developing severe disease and dying, including people 60 years of age or older or those with comorbidities that present increased risk of severe COVID-19 (e.g., heart disease, cancer and diabetes) should be advised to postpone travel to areas with community transmission,\" the WHO advice said.", "The advice comes after the emergence of the Omicron variant.", "First reported in southern Africa a week ago, the variant has brought global alarm, led to travel bans and highlighted the disparity between massive vaccination pushes in rich nations and sparse inoculation in the developing world.", "Dutch authorities have since said the\u00a0Omicron variant\u00a0was detected in the Netherlands a week before it was reported by South African authorities.\u00a0", "The United Nations health body said countries\u00a0should apply \"an evidence-informed and risk-based approach\" with any travel measures related to the Omicron variant of the coronavirus, including possible screening or quarantine of international passengers.", "But it said blanket bans would not prevent its spread.", "", "
The World Health Organization has urged countries not to impose flight bans on southern African nations\u00a0over the new Omicron variant.(AP: Jerome Delay)
", "\"Measures may include screening of passengers prior to travel and/or upon arrival, and use of SARS-COV-2 testing or quarantine of international travellers after thorough risk assessment,\" it said.", "All measures should be commensurate with the risk, time-limited and applied with respect to travellers' rights, it said.", "Some 56 countries were reportedly implementing travel measures aimed at potentially delaying import of Omicron as of November\u00a028, it added.\u00a0", "Australia\u00a0has banned flights from nine countries in southern Africa: South Africa, Namibia, Zimbabwe, Botswana, Lesotho, Eswatini, The Seychelles, Malawi and Mozambique.\u00a0", "The government has said the additional border security measures were proportionate, based on medical advice and were a precaution to protect Australians.", "South Africa's leader and others have criticised the travel bans, saying they were being punished for their transparency and alerting the world to the new variant.\u00a0", "Reuters/ABC"]
